invite: Invite other players with this link:
itemInfo: Pick one card from the item pool or from your hand, this card represents an item you have bought. In addition to the cost in the action space, you must pay $1 per card in the Market pool that has the same symbol as the item you just bought. There is no upper limit in the number of items you may own.
skillInfo: Take one of the cards from the skill pool or from your hand. This card will grant you skills for the rest of the game as detailed below. If you own more than one card of the same skill type you use that skill once per card you own.
auctionInfo: Choose one of the four cards in the Auction pool or one card from your hand. If you placed a card from your hand, you may place it face down. The card remains face down and the auction is performed without any other players knowing what kind of card it is. The player who chose this action may bid any number of coins with a minimum of one. Now the player to their left must place a higher bid or pass. Continue in clockwise order until all players but one has passed. The player that won the auction must pay the bid amount. When paying for the auction you may use cards from your hands as coins. The player tht wins the auction may place the card wherever they want; as an item, market share or as a skill
valueInfo: When executing this action, you must place cards in the market pool equal to the number of seals on your action space (one or two cards). You may place cards from your hand, from the card in the lowest position in the skill pool, or from the lowest card in the auction pool.
workInfo: In the work area, you perform actions to increase your income, recycle bottles, draw cards and become the first player. If you place your bottle in the uppermost action space (on the quarter tile), you must place two cards from your hand into the future income. If you place your bottle on the first action space, you must discard the placed bottle, this means that the bottle is lost and cannot be used in a future round. Note that the action space can be taken any number of times during the same quarter since it will always be empty. If you place your bottle on the second space, you get to draw two cards from the deck. If you place your bottle on the third space, you get to draw one card and you take the first player token. If you place your bottle on the fourth space, you must draw one card from the deck and place one card from your hand to the future income.
